sentence.Network_en: He walked among the displaced contours of her pectoral girdle.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'breastplate'): from Latin pectorale 'breastplate', pectoralis 'of the breast', from pectus, pector- 'breast, chest'

entry.def: Your pectorals are the large chest muscles that help you to move your shoulders and your arms.

example.ex: I was required to hold out my arms and flex my pectorals.
example.tran: 我被要求伸展手臂，收紧胸肌。

means.word_mean: 1. either of two large muscles of the chest
2. an adornment worn on the chest or breast
1. of or relating to the chest or thorax;
